data.title: Short and easy
data.text: This is a great place to take a quick stroll after lunch or dinner.  It is a short flat trail with great views of the river.

data.title: I got to be a kid again
data.text: I had a fun time with big legos and the freedom to make a 13' or so arched tower.  Then some other kids enclosed my two-year-old in a lego house.  Other than the pottery painting, most stuff here seemed to be building-oriented (legos, tubes, magnet tangrams, foam blocks).  They're looking to expand in a new facility soon, which will make this an even-more-worthy destination for play.

data.title: Lots of things to do for all ages
data.text: We love doing the pottery painting.  But they also have kids camps, special events, lego room, birthday parties, I am sure much more!

data.title: Learn and play
data.text: Adults and kids can find something to do and learn at Matter.  My son participated in a Lego contest.  They have classes, pottery painting...lots to do.

data.title: Lots of Fun - Keep the Kids Thinking!
data.text: Visiting from out of town, I took my grandson here for the afternoon. The time flew by and before we knew it we were approaching closing time. Best thing of all was a seeming unlimited source of Lego pieces and ideas for building projects. We did a couple of Pokemon images; looking for the right parts and then putting it all together was so much fun - and we helped each other out in the tough parts. When done, they had a place to display completed projects. They also had a room with steel panel walls and lots of "kit" with magnets - you could mount parts on the wall and arrange them to accomplish tasks - a great open-ended assignment for a budding engineer. We didn't even get to visit all of the creative possibilities - Highly recommended for kids to get them thinking!

data.title: Girls Night
data.text: Booked a 21+ painting class and had a wonderful time even though I am no artist.  We were able to bring down several bottles of wine as well as several appetizers to share with others.  It was such a fun thing to do.

data.title: Camp and visits
data.text: Great hands on learning for kids.  Make sure u sign up early as they offer a discount usually.  There is supervised care after camp but wish they had something before as well.

data.title: unexpectedly great
data.text: We didn't know what this was, but love it. It is a children/adult imagination/creative center. We were there on a free day but even normal admission is cheap. Can paint pottery (which we did) or build huge legos, or paint or (in the future) throw pottery. Great Place

data.title: Great programs
data.text: Kids have participated in several workshops and loved every one. My wife did an evening wine and painting class and loved it as well. Time and money well spent. Something for everyone.

data.title: Great place for kids.
data.text: This is a wonderful place to take kids to explore their creative side. From Legos to painting, any child will find something to create.

data.title: Can You Say FUN!
data.text: Fun, fun, fun for the family, be it immediate family, work family, extended family or just good friends!

data.title: Adult and kid classes
data.text: The classes there for kids are, I understand, terrific. I've been for Pino and Pottery, and that was loads of fun!

data.title: Classes
data.text: Love that you can take classes in various things.  Both children's and adult glasses are offered. A great display of the local artwork is fun to see.  Friendly staff always willing to help out.

data.title: Creativity oasis for young and old
data.text: So much fun! Matter is a non profit that offers several different ways to get your creative juices flowing. Pottery painting, Lego building lab, and so many great classes.

data.title: Visit with college student
data.text: Fun for the whole family!  Mom, Dad, Grandma, college student and kindergartner all had something fun to do.  Will definitely stop by again!

data.title: Neat place!
data.text: This was a really neat place to check out.  I had fun painting a ceramic bowl while my husband and son played with Legos.  My son also had fun painting a ceramic dinosaur. I look forward to checking it out again sometime especially as it seems they are going to be expanding their offerings soon.

data.title: Wonderful place for all!
data.text:
Painted pottery today with the whole family. Staff is lovely and kids of all ages enjoyed it including teenagers. I would highly recommend this.

There is food available right across the street at the Dubuque Food Coop, very handy.

data.title: great place to check out!
data.text: Great place to take the kids, a date or just girl time.  This is a great place to take a class or paint some pottery!  The staff is friendly.  My favorite - Pinot and Pottery and Bricks and Beer.  Where else can you enjoy a drink and be creative!

data.title: Hands on excellence!
data.text: I took a one-day stained glass workshop and LOVED it! Small class size (I think there were 8 of us) and we had 2 instructors! They were both super nice and helpful. I will be back... hopefully to take the full-length stained glass class!

data.title: Most fun day ever!!
data.text: My daughter in law and 3 year old grandson are visiting. Today I took them to visit Matter Creative. My daughter in law and I painted pottery while my grandson played Legos. Alyssa was the staff person on duty. She was so sweet, helpful and a hard worker. It was such a wonderfully relaxing and enjoyable two hours. We had such fun designing and painting our pottery and can't wait to get it after it's been fired. Matter has something for everyone. Kids, teens, young adults, parents and grandparents. Whether you live in Dubuque or are just visiting, Matter Creative is a place you will want to visit. It's unique and as fun as can be!
